title: Academic activities update
text:
Abstract submitted to the International Congress of Nutrion of Internationa Union of Nutritional Sciences.
Title: Expert guidelines on improving the quality of published aquatic food nutrient composition data for their inclusion in FCTs, FCDs, and evidenced based nutritional plans, policies and programmes.
Authors: Thiruchenduran Somasundaram1; Rita Hannisdal2; Siân Astley3; Hettie Schönfeldt4; Ananthan Rajendran5; Doris Rittenschober6; Fernanda Grande6; Sitilitha Masangwi7; Kendra Byrd8; Christina Hicks9; Marian Kjellevold10; International Community Of Practice On Nutrient Composition Of Aquatic Foods11




A brainstorming collaborative activity was carried out at Institute of Marine Research, Bergen from the 20th - 24th January, 2025 for the preparation of best practice checklist and guidance for producing aquatic food nutrient composition data. The activity was carried out between Dr. T C Somasundaram, Professor M Kjellevold, and Dr R Hannisdal



A collaborative manuscript drafting workshop with the aquatic food composition database experts from America, Australia, Belgium, France, Ghana, India, Italy, Malawi, South Africa, Spain, and United Kingdom. This writing workshop lasted for four days from the 14th - 17th January. The sessions resulted in three draft future focused manuscripts.



An excellence in research award (1st place) was given to the entire team who participated in the FAO - EAF NANSEN project, conducting the ecosystem survey in Sri Lankan waters while on-board the R/V Dr Fridtjof Nansen at the event organised by Sri Lanka Council for Agricultural Research and Policy in Colombo, December 2024.

title: Dr Thiru C Somasundaram
text:
Greetings and welcome to my professional scholar profile page, where you can get my research and scholarly updates as they happen along with additional links to connectred resources.
I am Dr Thiruchenduran Somasundaram also called as Dr Thiru C Somasundaram or T Somasundaram. You can call me simply Thiru!
I am currently located at Deakin Marine Centre, Queenscliff, Victoria 3225, Australia. Please say hi! to me, if you visit our amazing research facility.

title: Professional academic experience
text:
2025 A year of publications in the making







2025

A year of publications in the making




October 2024 - January 2025

Researcher, Lancaster Environment Center, Lancaster University, United Kingdom (Remote). As a part and on-behalf of an international team called “International Community of Practice on Nutrient Composition of Aquatic Foods”, I organised all the logistics (Flights, Visas, Ground transport, Meals and snacks, Accommodation, Venue, Remote Connectivity, Reimbursements, Health and safety) necessary to conduct a successful writing workshop in Rome, Italy for 18 in-person and 4 remote participants. This workshop was funded by Lancaster Environment Center and supervised by Professor Christina Hicks.

Project cost ~ £ 30,000








2024

A year of doctoral graduation and collaborations




February 2024 - December 2025

Casual Research Fellow, Nutrition and Seafood Laboratory (NuSea.Lab), Deakin University (Deakin Marine) at Queenscliff, Victoria 3225, Australia. As a research fellow I was involved in experimental designs, sampling protocol preparation, and biochemical analysis of feeds and tissue sample arising from a coral husbandry experiment carried out in collaboration with the Australian Institute of Marine Science, Townsville, Queensland, Australia. I also was involved in data engineering, data curation, scripting, data analysis and interpretation of the results of 3 experiments under this project.

Project cost ~ A$ 305,000





2020-2023

An academic in the making




January 2022 - December 2022

Research Consultant, Freelancer. I provided research consultation for an external research organization called Focus PVT LTD for an AgriFutures, Australia funded project on seaweed value addition for agricultural inputs along with the director Dr Jane Stanely. I directly contributed to the experimental design, execution of the field experiments, and writing one report and two fact sheets, one on regulatory reforms relating to seaweed use and the other one about practical farm use of seaweeds as outcomes of this project.

Project cost ~ A$ 40,000





January 2020 - December 2023

Ph.D. Candidate, Life and Environmental Sciences, School of Engineering and Built Environment, Deakin University. I completed my candidature at Nutrition and Seafood Laboratory (NuSea.Lab), Deakin University (Deakin Marine) at Queenscliff, Victoria 3225, Australia. As a Ph.D. Candidate I was involved in experimental designs, designing and validating protocols, sample collection, processing, and biochemical analysis of the processed and unprocesssed samples from three different experiments using a Phyllospora comosa (crayweed) macrophytes collected from Victoria, Australia. Further, I built machine learning predictive and classification models using experimental and simulated data. So far, I have published three manuscripts with high impact Elsevier Journals including Food Research International, Food Control, and Algal Research. Two more manuscripts arising from my Ph.D. results are currently being drafted.

Project cost ~ A$ 256,000





2016-2019

A national level independant scientist and a research manager




Decembre 2016 - August 2019

Scientist, Post Harvest (Marine), National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency, Sri Lanka. As a national scientist, every financial year, I carried out research projects and developmental projects in collaboration with several national and international organisations.
